item.title: NextEra 收购 Symmetry Energy 以拓展天然气业务
item.description: NextEra Energy 公司的基础设施部门同意收购紧密控股的 Symmetry Energy Solutions 公司，以扩大其在美国的天然气能力，并帮助满足人工智能电力需求的增长。【原文：NextEra Energy Inc.’s infrastructure arm agreed to acquire closely held Symmetry Energy Solutions to expand its natural gas capabilities in the US and help meet the boom in AI power demand.】

item.title: IBM 以 93 亿美元收购 Confluent，拓展人工智能服务领域
item.description: 国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines Corp. ）将以约 93 亿美元的价格收购数据流平台 Confluent Inc.【原文：International Business Machines Corp. is buying the data-streaming platform Confluent Inc. for about $9.3 billion, marking one of its largest takeovers yet and a major bet on the kind of enterprise software that artificial intelligence tools need to perform tasks in real time.】

item.title: 谷歌和 NextEra 将利用发电厂开发数据中心
item.description: Alphabet 公司的谷歌云（Google Cloud）与 NextEra 能源公司（NextEra Energy Inc.【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google Cloud and NextEra Energy Inc. reached an agreement to develop data centers paired with electric plants in the latest example of how intertwined the tech and power sectors have become.】

item.title: 债权人接管 EQT 旗下法国养老院运营商 Colisée
item.description: Colisée Group SAS 的高级贷款人将从目前的赞助商 EQT AB 手中接管该公司，以换取注销这家法国养老院运营商的部分债务。【原文：Senior lenders to Colisée Group SAS are taking over the company from current sponsor EQT AB in exchange for writing off some of the French nursing home operator’s debt.】

item.title: 英国监管机构调整零售规则以促进英国投资
item.description: 英国金融行为监管局（Financial Conduct Authority）正计划修改一系列规则，以方便英国人将自己的资金投资于市场。【原文：The Financial Conduct Authority is planning to change a swathe of rules to make it easier for Britons to invest their own money in markets.】

item.title: ExodusPoint 聘请艾斯勒的 Russel 帮助管理股票交易
item.description: ExodusPoint 资本管理公司聘请了前艾斯勒资本公司（Eisler Capital）资金经理杰夫-拉塞尔（Jeff Russel），帮助管理其在美国和欧洲的股票交易业务。【原文：ExodusPoint Capital Management has hired Jeff Russel, a former Eisler Capital money manager, to help run its stock trading business in the US and Europe.】

item.title: 对冲基金交易员在英国因奖金被拒而赢得 540 万美元官司
item.description: 一名伦敦对冲基金交易员被卷入了一场震惊华尔街的市场滥用调查，他为其前公司 Evolution Capital Management 扣留的数百万美元奖金打赢了官司。【原文：A London hedge-fund trader who was dragged into a market-abuse probe that rattled Wall Street won his legal fight for a multi-million dollar bonus withheld by his former firm Evolution Capital Management.】

item.title: 人工智能浏览器还不够智能，无法接管互联网
item.description:
一批尚未完全成熟的新产品正在将互联网分割成两条车道，迫使网站开发人员重新思考他们的网页是为谁而设。【原文：

A crop of under-baked new products is splitting the internet into two lanes, forcing website developers to rethink who their pages are for.

】

item.title: 加拿大房地产资金短缺，一家基金 "来者不拒
item.description: 加拿大的房地产市场正深陷重启。房价已从高峰期下跌了 17%，多伦多和温哥华的开发项目已减少到 2000 年代中期的水平。【原文：Canada’s real estate market is deep in a reset. Prices have fallen 17% from their peak, and development pipelines in Toronto and Vancouver have thinned to levels last seen in the mid-2000s.】

item.title: 拉扎德聘请前麦格理高管担任新兴债务部门联席主管
item.description: 拉扎德资产管理公司（Lazard Asset Management）聘请 Alex Kozhemiakin 帮助监督其在纽约的新兴市场债务平台。【原文：Lazard Asset Management hired Alex Kozhemiakin to help oversee its emerging-market debt platform in New York.】

item.title: 印尼在新出口收益规则中寻求堵塞外汇漏洞
item.description: 印尼正在寻求对大宗商品出口商如何使用外汇收入施加新的限制，这是印尼吸引更多资金到岸并支持东南亚最大经济体印尼盾持续疲软的努力的一部分。【原文：Indonesia is seeking to place new limits on how commodities exporters can use their foreign exchange earnings, part of efforts to draw more funds onshore and support a rupiah that has remained persistently weak in Southeast Asia’s largest economy.】

item.title: 罗布斯塔咖啡因顶级种植国越南供应充足而下跌
item.description: 罗布斯塔咖啡在伦敦跌至两个多月来的最低点，原因是越南供应充足，而越南是速溶咖啡的最大生产国。【原文：Robusta coffee fell to the lowest in more than two months in London amid ample supplies from Vietnam, the biggest producer of the variety used in instant drinks.】

item.title: 欧盟称 Meta 在被罚款 2 亿欧元后将修改广告政策
item.description: 欧盟表示，Meta Platforms 公司将为 Facebook 和 Instagram 用户提供一个替代选择，减少个性化广告的显示，这有可能避免在这家美国社交媒体公司被处以 2 亿欧元（约合 2.33 亿美元）罚款后与欧盟再次发生冲突。【原文：The European Union said Meta Platforms Inc. will offer Facebook and Instagram users an alternative choice that shows fewer personalized ads, potentially heading off another clash with the bloc after the US social media company was hit was a €200 million ($233 million) fine.】

item.title: Invesco 与 LGT 合作开展私募股权投资和零售信贷业务
item.description: Invesco Ltd. 与 LGT Capital Partners 合作，为美国零售和退休投资者提供另类资产投资组合，这是该公司扩大在私人市场影响力的又一举措。【原文：Invesco Ltd. is taking another step to expand its presence in private markets, teaming up with LGT Capital Partners on portfolios of alternative assets for US retail and retirement investors.】

item.title: Coreweave 因发行 20 亿美元可转换票据而股价下跌
item.description: CoreWeave 公司公布了通过发行可转换为股票的债务筹集 20 亿美元的计划，随后该公司股价下跌。【原文：CoreWeave Inc. shares fell after the company unveiled plans to raise $2 billion by issuing debt that can be exchanged for shares.】

item.title: 安达信前合伙人寻求通过首次公开募股融资 1.76 亿美元
item.description: 安达信集团公司是接替已关闭的会计巨头安达信（Arthur Andersen）的专业服务公司在美国的分支机构，该公司正寻求在首次公开募股中筹集 1.76 亿美元。【原文：Andersen Group Inc., the US arm of the professional services firm that succeeded the shuttered accounting giant Arthur Andersen, is seeking to raise $176 million in an initial public offering.】

item.title: 尽管动荡不安，俄罗斯与印度的石油贸易仍看似持久
item.description: 即使在当前的不利因素下，廉价原油的南下仍然是互惠互利的。【原文：Even with current headwinds, the flow of cheap crude south remains mutually beneficial.】

item.title: 凯雷集团据称将主导对日本 Hogy Medical 公司的竞购
item.description: 知情人士透露，美国收购公司凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：US buyout firm Carlyle Group Inc. has emerged as the frontrunner to acquire Hogy Medical Co., people with knowledge of the matter said, in a potential takeover that’s set to add to a Japanese dealmaking boom.】

item.title: 安特罗将以 28 亿美元从 HG 收购天然气生产资产
item.description: 安特罗资源公司（Antero Resources Corp. ）及其管道附属公司同意以合计 39 亿美元的现金从私人控股的 HG Energy II LLC 公司购买天然气生产和管道资产，在价格反弹之际扩大了天然气储备。【原文：Antero Resources Corp. and its pipeline affiliate agreed to buy natural gas production and pipeline assets from privately-held HG Energy II LLC for a combined $3.9 billion in cash, expanding its reserves of the fuel just as prices are rebounding.】

item.title: 亚马逊在裁员的同时将人工智能工具推荐为同事
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃德-勒德洛（Ed Ludlow）将报道亚马逊对人工智能在工作场所应用的看法。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow reports on Amazon’s view on the use of AI in the workplace.】

item.title: 银行钟爱重大风险转移— 监管机构对此忧心忡忡
item.description: 银行一直处于困境之中。它们希望发放更多贷款，以便更好地与非银行贷款机构竞争并提高利润，但 2008 年金融危机后实施的更严格规定却阻碍了它们的发展，这些规定要求它们留出额外资金，以弥补已发放贷款的潜在损失。这就减少了可用于开展新贷款或扩大公司规模的新资金。【原文：Banks have been in a bind. They want to make more loans so they can better compete against non-banking lenders and boost profits, but they have been hindered by tighter rules imposed after the 2008 financial crisis that require them to hold aside extra money to cover potential losses on the loans they have already made. This leaves less fresh capital available to pursue new lending or expand the company.】

item.title: OpenAI 发现人工智能平均每天为工人节省近一小时的时间
item.description: 在人们对人工智能的经济效益持怀疑态度之际，OpenAI 的人工智能产品为工人平均每天节省了约 40 到 60 分钟的专业工作时间。【原文：OpenAI’s artificial intelligence products are saving workers an average of about 40 to 60 minutes a day on professional tasks, according to a large survey conducted by the ChatGPT maker amid lingering skepticism of the economic benefits of AI.】

item.description: 特朗普国家安全政策的核心是一场远远超出美国范围的经济生存竞赛【原文：At the heart of Trump’s national-security policy is a race for economic survival that extends far beyond the US】

item.title: 国际清算银行称美国关税冲击推动全球外汇交易创纪录
item.description: 国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）的数据显示，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收贸易关税引发市场动荡后，全球外汇交易在今年创下历史新高，4月份日均交易额达9.5万亿美元。【原文：Global foreign-exchange trading surged to an all-time high this year, averaging $9.5 trillion per day in April after US President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs roiled markets, according to the Bank for International Settlements.】

item.title: 国际清算银行称，黄金暴涨表明避险资产转向投机资产
item.description: 据国际清算银行称，散户投资者推动了近期金价的飙升，将金银从传统的避风港模式推向了更具投机性的资产。【原文：Retail investors drove the recent gold price surge, pushing bullion out of its traditional safe haven pattern to a more speculative asset, according to the Bank for International Settlements.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司的变形纸作者首次发布开源模型
item.description: Essential AI Labs 是由开创性论文《变形金刚》（Transformer）的两位作者创办的一家初创公司，该公司推出了其首款模型，在中国企业主导人工智能领域之际，寻求推动美国的开源努力。【原文：Essential AI Labs, a startup founded by two authors of the seminal Transformer paper, unveiled its first model, seeking to boost US open-source efforts at a time when Chinese players are dominating that segment of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 企业急于通过债券市场获得低价并购资金
item.description: 早在交易完成之前，企业就开始趁着有利时机匆忙进入债券市场，寻求廉价的并购资金。【原文：Companies are hurrying to the bond market for cheap M&A funding while the going is good, long before their deals are even completed.】

item.title: 迫于预算压力，英格兰银行计划裁员
item.description: 本-伯南克（Ben Bernanke）建议进行的现代化改造的成本使英格兰银行的财政变得紧张，因此英格兰银行正计划裁员。【原文：The Bank of England is planning to reduce head count as its finances become strained by the cost of the modernizations recommended by Ben Bernanke.】

item.title: 华尔街在 5 亿美元瑞波币交易中对冲加密货币大赌注
item.description: 瑞波公司 11 月份 5 亿美元的股票销售吸引了华尔街的一些大佬，标志着加密货币从边缘资产类别演变为主流金融的一个里程碑。包括 Citadel Securities LLC 和 Fortress Investment Group 在内的投资者以 400 亿美元的估值支持该公司，创下了私有数字资产公司的最高纪录。【原文：Ripple’s $500 million share sale in November drew some of Wall Street’s biggest names and marked a milestone in crypto’s evolution from fringe asset class to mainstream finance. Investors including Citadel Securities LLC and Fortress Investment Group backed the firm at a $40 billion valuation, a record for a privately held digital-asset company.】
